## .big-text[Opening Files in Python]

---
## Python has built in <mark>**open()**</mark> to open a file.

.panelset[
.panel[
.panel-name[Syntax]
```{python, eval=FALSE}
open(file, mode="r")
```
- the *file* parameter is required

- *mode* has a default value of read in text
]

.panel[
.panel-name[Example]
```{python, eval=FALSE}
f = open("test.txt", "w") # write in text mode
print(f)
f = open("logo.png", "rb") # read in binary mode
print(f)
```

]

.panel[
.panel-name[Output]
```{python, eval=FALSE}
<_io.TextIOWrapper name='test.txt' mode='r' encoding='UTF-8'>
<_io.BufferedReader name='input.png'>
```
]

]

## .big-text[Closing Files in Python]

---

## Always close the file to free the resources.
.panelset[
.panel[
.panel-name[Basic]
```{python, eval=FALSE}
f = open("test.txt", "r")
# perform all file operations
f.close()
```
]

.panel[
.panel-name[Safe]
```{python, eval=FALSE}
try:
  f = open("test.txt", "r")
  # perform all file operations
finally:
  f.close
```

]

.panel[
.panel-name[Best]
```{python, eval=FALSE}
with open("test.txt", "r" as f:)
  # perform all file operations
```
]

]

---
# File Object Attributes
```{python, eval=FALSE}
closed()  # returns true if file is closed, false otherwise
mode()    # returns the access mode with which file was opened
name()    # returns the name of the file
```
